decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful colorless threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes tutors like Expedition Map and Ancient Stirrings to find the necessary Tron lands and threats quickly, while also having access to Karn, the Great Creator to shut down artifact-centric strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Shriekhorn, allowing for powerful graveyard recursion with cards like Creeping Chill, Prized Amalgam, and Bloodghast. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of dredge creatures and spells, creating a powerful board state and dealing damage from the graveyard. The synergy between graveyard recursion and dredge mechanics is crucial for the success of this Combo - Dredge archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Human tribal strategy. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up the team, along with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to quickly build a board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Reflector Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben provide additional disruption and tempo advantage.

The main idea of this deck revolves around quickly casting spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, while also using aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Faithless Looting, Light Up the Stage, and Finale of Promise help dig for more cards and maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, cheap burn spells like Lava Spike, Gut Shot, and Lightning Bolt provide direct damage and removal. The deck aims to be fast-paced and relentless in its attacks, overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. It aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells and utilizing powerful Eldrazi-themed lands to generate mana efficiently. The Eldrazi creatures in the deck have a mix of powerful abilities and high power and toughness, making it difficult for opponents to deal with them effectively. Additionally, the deck includes utility cards like Blast Zone and Relic of Progenitus to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with powerful Merfolk creatures such as Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. Utilizing cards like Merfolk Trickster and Vapor Snag to disrupt opponent's strategies and maintain control of the battlefield. Aether Vial is used to cheat in creatures and keep up pressure. Spreading Seas helps to fix mana and disrupt opponent's lands. With a combination of tempo plays and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as counterspells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to establish a stable board state through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while also limiting the opponent's resources with Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes powerful win conditions like Celestial Colonnade to close out the game once control is established. Overall, the deck focuses on outlasting the opponent and strategically navigating the game to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider to quickly ramp out huge creatures such as Griselbrand and Autochthon Wurm by sacrificing Chancellor of the Tangle. This combo allows for explosive plays and can often win the game in just a few turns. The deck also contains various ways to manipulate its library and generate mana to support the combo. With the right draws and timing, the deck can create an overwhelming board state that is difficult for opponents to come back from.

The main concept of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats and disrupting their strategy through hand disruption and removal spells. The Aggro - Jund archetype focuses on controlling the board with powerful cards like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Kolaghan's Command and Liliana of the Veil. The deck aims to quickly lower the opponent's life total and maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and other big creatures by utilizing cards like Farseek, Search for Tomorrow, and Solemn Simulacrum. The main goal is to eventually cast Scapeshift to trigger Valakut's ability and deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn. The inclusion of Primeval Titan and Zacama, Primal Calamity offers additional threats and utility, while cards like Courser of Kruphix provide card advantage and help with deck thinning. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of ramping, comboing off with Valakut, and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on using counterspells, board wipes, and planeswalkers to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate card advantage. Snapcaster Mage provides recurring value from instant and sorcery spells while Celestial Colonnade acts as a win condition. The deck aims to stall the game out and eventually win through incremental advantage and attrition. It has a mix of removal, card draw, and disruption to handle a variety of threats and strategies.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, allowing Arclight Phoenix to be easily brought back from the graveyard. Pyromancer Ascension and Manamorphose help generate additional spells to trigger the Phoenix's revival. Thing in the Ice provides a backup win condition by flipping into Awoken Horror. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and powerful creatures, while maintaining card advantage and flexibility through card draw and manipulation.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers and control spells to outvalue opponents and control the game. By constantly generating card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Cryptic Command, while also disrupting opponents with counter spells and removal like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to control the board and dictate the pace of the game. With a mix of card draw, removal, and counter magic, the deck aims to grind out wins by outmaneuvering opponents and overwhelming them with superior card advantage.

This deck focuses on playing a fast and aggressive game with a variety of Human creatures that benefit from each other's presence on the battlefield. Using cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch to get creatures out quickly, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of disruptive spells like Meddling Mage and tempo creatures like Reflector Mage. The mana base is optimized for casting creatures of any color, ensuring a smooth and consistent curve of threats to apply constant pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on aggressive play using a variety of Human creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to efficiently build a board presence with cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage. Aether Vial helps to cheat out creatures, while mana-fixing lands like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory ensure that the deck can cast its spells consistently.

The main concept of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent through low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and overwhelm them with a flurry of direct damage spells. With a mana base focused on fast land fetching and consistent access to the necessary colors of mana, this deck is built for speed and aggression in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.
